programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In and around Woking and Weybridge, Canadian craft-maker and housewife Sarah Maynard is the second to host. Her guests are in for a bit of a surprise as she wont be serving up maple syrup pancakes, but a three course Turkish feast.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Patricia Routledge Remembers
programme.desc: Patricia Routledge recalls how the character of Hyacinth Bucket first entered her life and looks back on the part she played in bringing to life one of TVs most formidable comedy characters. She describes the pleasures of working with her fellow cast members, shares her thoughts on why Hyacinths husband Richard endured all the years with his social-climbing wife, and explains why - despite her fondness for every element of the programme.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard forgets his wedding anniversary but then tells Hyacinth that he had a new alarm installed as an anniversary present, only he has forgotten the code.

programme.title: Patricia Routledge Remembers
programme.desc: Miss Pyms Day Out saw Patricia Routledge portray legendary author Barbara Pym in an RTS Award-winning episode of Bookmark, set on the day of the 1977 Booker Prize Awards, of which Pyms Quartet in Autumn was nominated. The novel marked a huge revival and interest in Pyms work after 16 years, and in this introduction, Patricia gives us a sense of what it was like to tell this incredible story, from the encounters with Pyms family that were involved in the project.

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary about the writer Barbara Pym, depicting one day in her life - 23 November 1977 - when she travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Patricia Routledge plays Barbara Pym.

programme.title: Patricia Routledge Remembers
programme.desc: Talking Heads was Alan Bennetts acclaimed series of one-off tele-plays, written specifically for a selection of some of his favourite actors, including the great Patricia Routledge. Here, Patricia recalls what it was like to receive the scripts that were so perfectly suited to her comic abilities: A Woman of No Importance, A Lady of Letters and Miss Fozzard Finds Her Feet. She describes the challenges of bringing three unique characters to life for television.

programme.title: Talking Heads
programme.desc: Irene Ruddocks mother died some years ago and she lives alone. A one-woman Neighbourhood Watch scheme, her habit of writing letters to the appropriate authorities gets ridiculously out of hand.

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: How thousands of strange nocturnal birds make their home on the tiny island of Bardsey in North Wales, and an exploration of the rich history of the island itself.

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: In a vast, crumbling Soviet-era sanatorium on the shores of Odesa, thousands arrive each summer in search of healing. Some come for the legendary black mud, rumoured to cure everything, from infertility to joint pain. Others are looking for something less tangible: connection, laughter, even love.

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: Simon explores Spains golden age under Philip II through to the Spanish Civil War and dictatorship under Franco, from which Spain has emerged as a modern democratic monarchy.

programme.desc: Dramatised documentary about the writer Barbara Pym, depicting one day in her life - 23 November 1977 - when she travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Patricia Routledge plays Barbara Pym.

programme.title: Imagine...
programme.desc: Romantic, fearless, fantastical: delve into the thrilling world of Philip Pullman, and explore the authors own dark materials. Philip has been named both one of Britains greatest writers and the most dangerous writer in Britain. He is best known for the much-loved `His Dark Materials trilogy, which follows a young heroine, Lyra, through a series of heart-stopping adventures into other worlds.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A developer follows his mothers advice in Bushey Heath and is surprised to hear the potential profit if he sells the ground floor flat. An estate agent is blown away by a house in Pontypool. Two friends transform a terraced house in Croydon.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross visits the Royal Armouries Museum in Leeds to see an impressive collection of human, horse, and elephant armour. Another battle is taking place at an antiques fair in Wetherby, waged by two teams of friends. In the red corner, it is pals Hannah and Verity, captained by Izzie Balmer. Their opponents in blue are boat fitters Giles and Huw, skippered by David Harper.

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Vehicle recovery specialist Richard is tracking expensive farmyard vehicles stolen in broad daylight. He traces them to a scrap yard, but as he arrives, theyre on the move again.

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: Mui, our social media detective, has been scouring the internet for people who might need our help, which sends us on a hunt for a treasured missing teddy bear. The team also take on a devastated couples search for two lost pieces of jewellery with real sentimental value, and can crafter Lucy turn a discarded ceramic pot into treasure once more?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Missing family and the great British countryside, todays couple are heading home to Warwickshire having spent the last six years living and working in the USA. Jules Hudson helps with their house search and visits an 18th century walled garden to meet the volunteers who help keep it in tip-top condition.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team revives a dilapidated carved village sign that has stood pride of place in Broome, Norfolk since the turn of the millennium, along with a handmade organ crafted in Basra during World War I.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Too often overlooked in research and marginalised in society, many young dads across the UK are quietly rewriting the rulebook on fatherhood. In this revealing documentary, Joe Swash, who became a first-time father in his mid-twenties, meets four young men navigating the challenges of parenting. From stigma and financial strain to isolation and emotional growth, this is the rarely seen lived experience of men in their teens and twenties entering into fatherhood.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Never mind about stairs up to the bedrooms, wheres the front door?? Dion has to figure it out in a three-bedroom mid-terrace in South Yorkshire. Tommy is in east London to deal with a knotty problem in the garden at a one-bedroom flat. And Martel is in Darlington to navigate her way around a nicotine-stained terrace.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Great Scott! Roo Irvine gets behind the wheel of a DeLorean DMC-12, the car that famously featured as a time machine in the 1985 hit movie, Back to the Future. Built on the peace lines in Northern Ireland, the DMC-12s design was ahead of its time, with its angular, stainless-steel bodywork and eye-catching, gull-wing doors. At the Ulster Transport Museum, Roo meets two men who test-drove the first cars to come off the production line.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Did you know that the Victorians invented films? Not only that, but one of the first stars of the moving image was Queen Victoria. Using real footage recently restored by the BFI, this special show takes a look at the Victorians obsession with film. We see some of Queen Vickys very first filmic appearances (also featuring an initially reluctant Tsar Nicholas I), and also how the Victorians became obsessed with filming everything.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: Viking Eye for the Straight Guy
programme.desc: From the ancient Egyptians pioneering smelling good (a heady mix of fat and perfume plonked on your head, so that it would gradually melt throughout the day and make you smell all lovely and fragrant), to Coco Chanel turning fashion for women on its head, this show brings you the Horrible History of looking good. Featuring some of fashions greatest innovations, pioneers, and victims, we look at how the way people have dressed has had an impact on their lives.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Birminghams Hockley Social Club has been transformed into our very own comedy club. programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three student film-makers, Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Mike Williams, set off into the woods near Burkitsville, Maryland, in search of the truth behind the legends of the Blair Witch. They never returned but, a year later, their footage was found.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared. Are they ready to re-ignite their love, or is it one final near miss?

programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit on `Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows it is his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. If the day goes well, it could catapult his career, but if it goes badly, it is game over.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black

programme.desc: Three student film-makers, Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Mike Williams, set off into the woods near Burkitsville, Maryland, in search of the truth behind the legends of the Blair Witch. They never returned but, a year later, their footage was found.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared. Are they ready to re-ignite their love, or is it one final near miss?

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit on `Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows it is his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. If the day goes well, it could catapult his career, but if it goes badly, it is game over.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena must ask Simon for a favour, but at a price. With his dream within reach, Kwabena has big choices to make.

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: A vibrant new sketch show created by and starring Danielle Vitalis. Meet the driving instructor from hell, a trifling West Indian judge, and the podcaster who will say sorry for anything if it means more money and more followers.

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Too often overlooked in research and marginalised in society, many young dads across the UK are quietly rewriting the rulebook on fatherhood. In this revealing documentary, Joe Swash, who became a first-time father in his mid-twenties, meets four young men navigating the challenges of parenting. From stigma and financial strain to isolation and emotional growth, this is the rarely seen lived experience of men in their teens and twenties entering into fatherhood.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the Cumbrian countryside with a sporty couple chasing a fresh start, with plans for a carpentry business and plenty of outdoor adventures.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The Bear Ladies restore a stuffed monkey that turned royal heads. The team also fix a cake topper emblematic of a circus childhood and a Second World War helmet that survived the Blitz.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Today, Kamran, Abi, Livi and Nigel battle it out to see which one of them is unbeatable.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: South West England: Starter and Fish
programme.desc: Four chefs compete for south west England with canapes, starters and fish dishes inspired by great Britons of the past. Who will be eliminated?

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Three hundred thousand square miles of ocean. Three GPS-tracked voyages, filmed around the clock. One week at sea. Storm Arwen hits the UK, with the potential to affect the countrys entire fishing fleet. In the North Sea, pair trawlers Victory Rose and Our Lass must come together each time they haul, making them vulnerable to collision in bad weather.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit Herstmonceux Castle and antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find treasures to take to auction, including some beautiful bronze sculptures. Also, Paul Martin takes a trip on a very large miniature railway.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Kola Bokinni, Sheli McCoy, John Parrott and Katie Piper test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Fleur East dishes up some more unmissable backstage gossip and behind-the-scenes action from the world of Strictly as the couples prepare for their next dances. Also, Choreography Corner looks back at more of the weekends performances.

programme.title: Nigella: At My Table
programme.desc: Nigella shares Ideas for feasts throughout the day from parmesan french toast and golden egg curry to juicy lamb kofta, rose and pepper pavlova with strawberries, and white chocolate cheesecake.

programme.title: Chronicles of the Sperrins
programme.desc: Its winter. As the Sperrins are covered in snow, then battered by Storm Darragh, work continues around the mountains to restore and protect this area of outstanding natural beauty.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Prof Alice Roberts follows a year of British archaeology, joining up the results of digs.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.sub-title: Series W: Wales, Whales and Wails
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig considers Wales, whales, and wails with Elis James, Griff Rhys Jones, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Actor Will Mellor cajoles comedian and good friend Keith Lemon into joining him on a high-octane Albanian road trip.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Rob Brydons Honky Tonk Road Trip
programme.desc: Rob explores the rich, often-overlooked influence of black musicians on the history of country music during the genres 100th anniversary year.

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.desc: Teddy is home from the vets, Stacey inherits a swarm of bees, and the BAFTAs loom - with Joe away working, can she juggle five kids, a poorly pooch, bees and red carpet glam?

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: With the first banishment sending shockwaves throughout the castle, the Traitors dont wait long to commit their next murder. As a new day dawns, the celebrity players turn their focus to a mission that forces them to work very closely as a team under punishing conditions. But as night falls, will their teamwork continue in the Round Table and result in catching a Traitor, or will they inadvertently banish a fellow Faithful?

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by murdered and banished Players for exclusive chat. Also, Faithful Maddy and Traitor Freddie join for gameplay analysis and need-to-know Traitors intel.

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Richard Clifford presents an appeal on behalf of React, a charity dedicated to helping children with life-shortening illnesses by providing specialist equipment and respite breaks for them and their families.

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Marcus develops plans to add a regional Sussex staple, nut trees. Jumping over the border to Kent, he discovers the cobnut, a kind of cultivated hazelnut, and gets tips and tricks on growing his own.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.desc: When a duckling hatches from an egg in Moletown, Moley must care for it until they find its home. While Moley helps care for worms at Dottys Adopt a Worm Rescue Centre, the Gardener sends Squirm to pose as a homeless worm and help him steal Manny.

programme.desc: A wild creature is stealing jewellery from the residence of Crystal Cove. Meanwhile Freds real parents are in town with a dog that catches Scoobys eye.

programme.desc: The gang investigate the disappearance of a prized poodle by using Scooby as a decoy to unveil the thief... until Scooby is also kidnapped.

programme.desc: The gang tours an old Hollywood Studio, but they soon uncover a mystery concerning the ghost of a silent film comedy star who has returned to make sure his recently discovered final film is never seen.

programme.sub-title: Returning Of The Key Ring!; The Tao Of Scoob!
programme.desc: When the Gang does brunch with Daphnes longtime friend, famous actor SEAN ASTIN, the only mystery on their mind is how to split the check. / Scooby Dooby Doo takes the gang to meet his good friend, Lucy Liu, at her art gallery in Queens.

programme.title: Whats New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: When six puppies are dog-napped, its up to Scooby and Mystery Inc to rescue them. While attending the Grind Games, the gang runs into the ghost of an Alcatraz prisoner who is targeting members of the competition.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Its Scoobys dream come true as the gang visits the set of his favourite TV show and he meets the star of the show and his celebrity crush, a dog actress, who plays a detective on the screen.The gang venture in an intricate labyrinth of crystal.

programme.title: This is CBBC!
programme.desc: Join the CBBC crew for all your favourite programmes. Tune into CBBC every day from 7.00am.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer glues the Farmers broken glasses back together - but when the flock get their hooves on the tube of glue, things start to get very sticky.

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Having put the Danger Babies through their adorable paces, Professor Squawkencluck leaves it to Danger Mouse to settle them down with a story. Unfortunately, Danger Mouse scares his audience with a tale that reimagines him as an evil villain.

programme.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
programme.desc: Herbert is starting to feel his age and secretly drinks from the Fountain of Youth. However, his desire to be young puts the whole quest in jeopardy.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: When Cheese tells Boy he has been the victim of a weredog staredown, he becomes convinced he will turn into a weredog too.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the TV remote control. The argument leads the bear to the summit of the castle tower during a storm.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a lot of fun painting themselves on portraits of noblemen in the castle. Grizzy also wants to paint himself and takes away all the painting materials. The enraged Lemmings are determined to get them back.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Karen gets a computer virus, and it is up to SpongeBob to try and get it out of her.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Over a board game, Captain O takes Ozzie and Orli back to her time at sea with the case of villain Dottie Dubloon and how she used dice to throw Odd Squad off.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Two aspiring warrior-heroes and a lively ghost girl refine the skills they need to take the place of an ageing monster-slayer by completing his odd, supernatural chores.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: It is the 50th anniversary of Webbthorpe Leisure Centre. Joy has asked Danny and Mick to set up the sports hall for a celebration party. The hall looks amazing, and Danny and Mick have some extra decorations to make sure the party goes with a bang.

programme.title: Bitesize: 7-9 Year Olds
programme.desc: Learn about counting in thousands and placing value in four digits.

programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: Explore what would happen if bugs went away. Food would disappear, and there would be dung everywhere.

programme.title: Our School
programme.desc: A storm hits, putting half-term plans in jeopardy, and Valentina faces a challenging new English project.

programme.title: Go Get Arty
programme.desc: The Kwapongs make space skittles, and Kiell Smith-Bynoe gets spooky.

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Cam, Tyler and Aaron look after the zoos marvellous mums and mums-to-be. While there are questions over whether Laila the snow leopard is expecting a cub, the capybaras have three adorable surprises.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Tali started doing magic when she was three and has packs of cards in every room of the house to ensure a magic trick is never far away. She is frustrated that there have not been any great female magicians and wants to change that. She needs a magic den where she can practice her tricks in secret, without giving the game away!

programme.title: Absolute Genius: Monster Builds
programme.desc: Dick and Doms quest takes them into the world of renewable energy. In the Nevada desert, they discover how the suns energy could keep the world powered forever. At the Hoover Dam, they uncover the genius behind how a lake can generate power.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Watch King Alfred the Great argue with his older brothers, then defeat the Vikings using his cunning hit-and-run tactics, summoning the spirit of Ed Sheeran. Meanwhile, across the world and Ant and Dec host a very special Chinese edition of Im A Celebrity.

programme.title: Our Black History Heroes
programme.desc: Rose stands up for inspirational civil rights activist Rosa Parks.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: Clive has forgotten to book an audience for wrestling night and two of the wrestlers have pulled out. That means only one thing, its time for Danny and Mick to showcase their wrestling skills.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Rockers Leo and Jimi are unfairly locked in detention by their strict headteacher and will miss their first ever gig unless the band can bust them out. Its time for a crazy plan!

programme.title: Gladiators: Epic Pranks
programme.desc: Nitro pranks Electro at a fake fashion photoshoot when her fabulous, precious dress is ruined. Meanwhile, the other Gladiators are up to mischief behind the scenes at the Arena.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: Octonauts and the Poison Dart Frogs
programme.desc: Whether its a perilous voyage to the bottom of the sea or the piratey pursuit of a giant squid, the Octonauts leap into action. The Octonauts find out about poison dart frogs.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima takes over Dads mission to film a unique underwater plant. But his special camera proves harder to operate than shed thought, and Big Lizard keeps getting distracted.

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: When a teenage Squawk goes on the rampage, DM summons her Twistyverse counterpart to talk some sense into her. But he overlooks one vital thing, a twisty Squawk is an evil Squawk!

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Colonel K spins a terrifying tale about the Headless Postman, who is an ancient and alarmingly scary apparition. When the haunting figure of the postman suddenly appears, petrified panic reigns supreme amongst the Danger Agents.

programme.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
programme.desc: The heroes are lured away by a cloaked figure to compete for the title of `Quester of the Year, leaving the forest with no one to protect its scones.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: On the way to Padgets shop, Bing and Flop stop to play with Arlo the cat. Bing loves Arlo and knows just where he likes to be stroked and what games he likes playing. On the way home, Bing spots a new cat but this one isnt so friendly and scares Bing when he tries to play with it.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po run around in circles in the Home Dome. The Noo-noo joins in and the Teletubbies have fun chasing.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea takes over the Tato Tower HQ and uses Carrots new security system to keep Supertato out. Supertato and Carrot work on a cunning ice cream plan to sneak back in.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its Potato dedicating a song to his uncle Spud, who went on a spaceship to the moon.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tees friend Lily the Tiger comes over to play.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is waiting to sit in the fire engine at the park. Pando and Sula both get a turn, but when it is Bings go there is an emergency and the fire engine has to leave.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: The Printing Crew come to the rescue and print signs for their friends Red, Blue and Green.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is making jam but Naughty Monkey steals all of Duggees fruit. Can the squirrels help catch him?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels meet a chameleon called Cosey and learn about how to blend into their surroundings, earning their Camouflage Badges in the process!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Tired of being told what to do, Bluey and Bingo enlist their giant invisible friend to show Mum and Dad whos boss. Now they can do anything they want, until Mum and Dad rebel.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Mum are off to Chloes party and Bingo isnt invited. When a passing cockatoo drops a feather, Bingo has an idea for a new game called `Featherwand, and when she waves her Featherwand she can make objects impossibly heavy.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.sub-title: Go Jet Academy: Lightning Bolt Blackout
programme.desc: Xuli, Foz and the cadets have travelled to a small island near the Academy for some birdwatching. But when an electrical storm strikes the Academy, they end up stranded! Back in the library, Glitch and Kyan have to use their ingenuity to break out and help the others.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When a very sleepy Tommy Brock is hoisted up into the Squirrel Camp, Peter and friends must work out how to get the snoozing brute back down to earth before he wakes up!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above and Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts expand their exploration beyond the sea - and onto land. With new rides and new friends, they are prepared to protect any habitats and animals at risk on land or under the water.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: One to Fours pet bugs are racing on special tracks, but can they follow the perimeter?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: H makes a hen, who lays an egg, which rolls away. The `Alphablocks hop to it, give chase and discover the egg sat on a wall, about to have a great fall.

programme.title: Nick Copes Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and Norman are stuck up a 100-year old oak tree. Nick discovers Grandpas old guitar and remembers playing it many years ago with his mum, under the same old oak tree.

programme.title: Justins House
programme.desc: When everybody decides to dress up as superheroes, Robert is disappointed because he doesnt have a costume. Can Robert save the day without one? Guest starring Sid Sloane and Rebecca Keatley.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Cocos dance, Pandos song and Sulas acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bings finale. When he gets up on the stage, Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends and rainbow fairy mice come to the rescue.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! In this episode, Dee encourages a friend to say ball and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different balls and explore how they look and what they do. Theres a green ball, a blue ball and even a ball that goes moo! Theres a seat ball, some meatballs and a funny ball too. We see a ball to kick, a ball for disco dancing and a sparkly ball on a Christmas tree.

programme.title: Lu and the Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Lu struggles to find any treasure whilst at the park. Lu and Declan race their home toys and Declan is a bit careless. Barnaby gets upset when he cant contribute to Lus silly soup. The bugs talk about what theyd like to do when they grow up.

programme.title: Piggy Builders
programme.desc: Brian asks the Piggies to help him grow a very special little plant. They nurture it as their pet plant, and it grows - so much that they can no longer keep it at home. Parting with their beloved plant feels impossible.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a man as he covers his car in cleaning foam. Chickedy and Chick squirt foam everywhere.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a zoo, where they meet pandas, lemurs and elephants. Meanwhile, Tumble Cottage ends up full of animals when all the teddies have play dates.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies cant get enough of the Tubby Custard Ride so they ask to go on it again and again! In Tummy Tales, children play on a slide again and again.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Roman, Rose-May, Zachary, Thomas, Finley, Ferne and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! In this episode we meet a new friend, Baby Tiger. There are scarves inside everyones bags which are explored through discovery, play, song and story.

programme.title: I Spy, You Spy
programme.desc: Elsee meets her new friend Amara at the train station and plays a game of I Spy.

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie and Triggs are camping in the woods with Dad. But when rain comes to spoil their campfire fun, they all rush into the tent. Dad is not happy, but a visit from a happy little raindrop soon has the whole gang up and dancing about the tent.

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the waiter wants to give his customer what they want, but when word spreads about how good he is, his restaurant staff want to be diners too!

programme.title: Kiri and Lou
programme.sub-title: Whats It Like to be a Tree?
programme.desc: Kiri and Lou try out being trees, which is mostly about keeping still, and make a very large new friend named Moa.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Playing Butterflies in the backyard is great fun, until Bluey runs away with Judo, leaving Bingo all alone. Now poor Bingos heartbroken and Bluey needs to make amends.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are helping Duggee clean his things, such as an old desk and lamp. They learn about stories which told that the lamp could grant three magical wishes. When they rub the lamp clean, they meet Professor Jeanie, who can grant them three wishes through the magic power of science. She amazes the Squirrels with her scientific experiments that bring their wishes alive, whilst educating them along the way.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Catchers arrive on a planet populated by one-eyed sphere-shaped aliens.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The class makes things out of scrap and Timmy is proud of his splendid tractor, made using a cereal box, toilet roll and jam jar lids. As he parades it around the nursery he finds his friends having problems with their make-and-dos. Will Timmy lend them his tractor parts to help out?

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Amanpreet and her family are off on a animal adventure. They visit a safari park where they join the lions for a spot of lunch from the safety of their safari bus. Later, Amanpreet turns her hand to zookeeping.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Cassava cake is a very popular dessert in the Philippines, so Reese is making a very special version for her friends to try when they come to visit. Reeses family come from the Philippines and this recipe is a family favourite. This is a cake that has lots of savoury ingredients such as cheddar cheese and cassava but also includes sweet flavours such as condensed milk and coconut cream.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Rory and Sandy are searching for lizards while Chantelle discovers what they eat. Find out how lizards help the eco-system and try a Teeny Tiny Task, lizard camouflage art.

programme.title: Whats on Your Head?
programme.desc: Firefighter Karen shows off her helmet. See how important it is for Karen to wear it while she does her heroic job, as well as some of the amazing things it does.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.desc: Its autumn time. Jud, Jessica and their class visit a local park to collect leaves for an art project. Back at school, they use the leaves to create a huge leaf print picture - and things end up getting messy! The school playground is covered in leaves and the school caretaker, Mr Clever, needs help clearing them up. Luckily, he has a team of super leaf sweepers, who come to the rescue.

programme.title: Graces Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three amazing machines that are all made to go off-road. Grace drives the funny spider car, shows off the daring Formula Off Road buggies and goes for a drive in an eight-wheeled all-terrain vehicle.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `octopus, and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see a giant octopus, a tiny octopus, a swimming octopus and a gardening octopus! Dee meets a spinning octopus and a pirate octopus.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Learn to recognise amounts from the shapes they make with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks meet their match when Brown Cow and her singing friends Owl, Howl and Growl take the stage! This episode has fun with the -ow- digraph and the words cow, brown, owl, howl, growl, gown, crown, town and down.

programme.title: Wonderblocks
programme.desc: The Wonderblocks help Arty hop in different directions to light up the disco floor!

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Welcome to Purples mixing factory, where he mixes two colours to create a new colour. In this musical episode, the Colourblocks learn that mixing red and yellow makes orange, whilst adding black and white helps to make darker and lighter colours.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are crafting in the Clubhouse when Betty saves Tag from throwing water across the table instead of glitter. Tag, although full of enthusiasm and energy, has not always been the best listener. He was great at discovering new things, and everyone wanted to join in with him - but getting easily distracted would land him in an array of trouble.

programme.title: Yukee
programme.desc: Stripes worries that the Sundial Stage isnt loud enough when his guitar hero comes to play a gig. With Yukees help, Stripes is determined to turn the volume up to 11, but is that too loud?

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Fishy fun with Justin and his friends as they visit an aquarium and meet a diver. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble in on the hunt for some underwater treasure.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: When its time for the Tubby Custard Ride, theres a special trailer the Teletubbies havent seen before. Its for The Noo-Noo who gets to go on a special Tubby Custard Ride.

programme.title: Andys Safari Adventures
programme.desc: Andy heads to the jungles of Papua New Guinea and meets a Bowerbird building its nest.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: While Zoe helps Doug with his homework project about Alaska, Simon and Jess take Waffle and Evie to the shops to buy new school shoes. But Waffles attempts to help end up causing chaos.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks stall. She chooses the litter badge and remembers the day she got it... Daisy has a day off and Mack wants to spend the afternoon alone with her. Daisy wants to pick up litter on the beach, and Molly volunteers to join them and invites all her friends to come along too. Mack isnt thrilled about this.

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Something strange is going on in the Jingly Jangly Jungle. Every time Raa Raa visits a friend there is a loud roar - and it isnt him! Who could it be? Raa Raa sets off to find out.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Game Catchers land on a very sensitive planet to play throwers and targets.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When a sardine swallows the key to a treasure chest, a humpback whale helps Kwazii track it down.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Lost Tunnels
programme.desc: When Benjamin gets lost in a network of underground tunnels, Peter and Lily set out to find him.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: A big box of bits and pieces is delivered to the Clubhouse and the Squirrels are very excited. Duggee and the Squirrels will have to work very hard to put it all together, so its time for a bit of teamwork.

programme.title: Vida the Vet
programme.desc: When Zigzag needs to wear an eye patch, Vida enlists the help of Molasses, the seeing eye snail, but Zigzag refuses.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea makes her car voice controlled, but it gets cross when she isnt nice to it.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dads favourite record wont play anymore, so Cosima and Big Lizard secretly plan to learn the song and surprise him. However, they have trouble recruiting a drummer.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Its secret agent time when Mojo and Bo think Didi the tractor is up to something fishy. But can these two supersecret spies follow her without being spy-spotted?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Tired of being told what to do, Bluey and Bingo enlist their giant invisible friend to show Mum and Dad whos boss. Now they can do anything they want, until Mum and Dad rebel.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Mum are off to Chloes party and Bingo isnt invited. When a passing cockatoo drops a feather, Bingo has an idea for a new game called `Featherwand, and when she waves her Featherwand she can make objects impossibly heavy.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Pancakes golden algae goes missing, leaving all the Piri friends under suspicion.

programme.title: Dodges Pup School
programme.desc: Dodge is determined to win the Class Star award, but with Cherry winning every week for being a superstar at everything, its going to be tough! Dodge, Woofer and Jazz try to hatch a plan, but when Jazz and Dodge get swept up in their ideas, like getting Miss Collie a gift, they ignore Woofers advice that theres a better way. Dodge brings Miss Collie a gift into the classroom from the playground and chaos ensues, leaving Dodge with no hope of winning the class star.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle is unwell. Hes in his pyjamas and under strict orders to stay in bed and rest. But poor Waffle cant get comfy. When he sees Evie and Simon playing in the garden, he feels left out and begins to woof and woof. Simon tells Waffle to rest quietly, but its too late. The wonder dogs incessant barking has already disturbed Mrs Hobbs next door and, to make matters worse, like Waffle shes not feeling well either.

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Oona and Baba try to help Mossy overcome his fear of thunder and lightning.

programme.title: JoJo and Gran Gran
programme.sub-title: Autumn: Its Time to Make a Family Tree
programme.desc: Great-Gran Gran shows JoJo an old family photo. Its fun spotting Gran Gran, Mummy and Great-Gran Gran when they were younger. JoJo recognises some people, but there are lots of members of her family that shes never met before.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Pepi Nana is big and Little Nana is small. When the two friends go for a walk together, they discover how they see things differently, and how much fun that can be.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: A Skymoo accidentally knocks the Iron Chicken out of her nest, and in falling to the surface of the Clangers planet she hurts her wing. But although Major Clanger manages to mend it, she has lost her confidence and cant fly. It takes all the ingenuity of Small Clanger, and another intervention by the Skymoo, to get her back to her nest under her own wing power.

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy and Igglepiggle are going for a walk in the garden and it is a very windy day. The trees are blowing side to side, Igglepiggles blanket gets blown up and up into the air, and the Tombliboos are outside their house and now their trousers have been blown off the line.

programme.desc: Mike considers adopting a baby abandoned at a press conference, and Mikes old girlfriends voice opinions about him.

programme.sub-title: The One Without the Ski Trip

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr, wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years older than him. Elsewhere, Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape intended to assist Chandler give up smoking has a rather strange effect on him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: Rachels former colleague Mark asks her out on a date. When Rachel invites Ross to her apartment, he thinks she wants to get back together, but she just wants to return his things. Later, as Rachel and Mark return from their date, Ross spies on them through the peephole of Joey and Chandlers door. Meanwhile, Monica dates a millionaire, and Joey is cast in a play and clashes with the female lead.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica inherits a beautiful dollhouse that is too elaborate to play with, so Phoebe makes her own, but it meets a sad end. Meanwhile, Joey thinks hes found his true love, and Rachels boss dates Chandler, placing her in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With a Chick and a Duck
programme.desc: When Monicas millionaire friend Pete buys a restaurant and asks Monica to be the head chef, she is faced with a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Ross makes a sacrifice for Rachel, and Joey buys Chandler an unusual pet.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends go to the opening night of one of Joeys plays. When Rachel finds out that Ross is bringing a date, she finds one of her own. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross develops a skin growth that doctors cant identify.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ultimate Fighting Champion
programme.desc: Monica finds herself dating a guy who wants to be the Ultimate Fighting Champion. Meanwhile, Chandler finds his male bosss attentions just a little too friendly, and the group overhear a scandalous conversation at Central Perk.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe invites everyone to stay at her massage clients beach house for the weekend. Phoebe meets someone who knows details about her family, Rachel expresses her jealousy of Ross uninhibited girlfriend, and Joey nags the friends into agreeing to play a party game that requires the participants to gradually take off items of clothing.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Joey lose all their furniture, Monica finds that one date with her high-school heartthrob is more than enough, and Ross plays tricks on Rachel following their break-up. Elsewhere, Phoebe is temporarily convinced that a cat is the reincarnation of her dead adoptive mother Lily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler has a brief fling with Rachels boss Joanna which leaves him handcuffed without his trousers in her office. Meanwhile, Joey can only afford one book in an encyclopaedia set, and Monica caters a party for her mother.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ballroom Dancing
programme.desc: Joey argues with the building superintendent Treegar and ends up having to help him practise ballroom dancing. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler cant get out of their gym membership even though neither of them wants to exercise, and Phoebe loses her massage job for kissing a client.

programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys New Girlfriend
programme.desc: Chandler falls for Joeys new date, Ross discovers that the woman that he thinks hes dating actually thinks hes the babysitter, Rachels new college boyfriend steals, and Phoebe tries to re-catch a cold to improve her singing voice.

programme.sub-title: The One With the Dirty Girl
programme.desc: Phoebe and Monica decide to go into business together after they cater a funeral where the widow tries not to pay, and Ross date with the beautiful Cheryl goes awry when he kills a rat in her filthy apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Crosses the Line

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike considers adopting a baby abandoned at a press conference, and Mikes old girlfriends voice opinions about him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Without the Ski Trip
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel have been fighting for the groups attention since the break up. Rachel invites everyone except Ross to her family cabin in the mountains, but on the way to the cabin, they run out of petrol. Everyone wants to call Ross for help, but Rachel wont let them.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr, wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years older than him. Elsewhere, Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape intended to assist Chandler give up smoking has a rather strange effect on him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: Rachels former colleague Mark asks her out on a date. When Rachel invites Ross to her apartment, he thinks she wants to get back together, but she just wants to return his things. Later, as Rachel and Mark return from their date, Ross spies on them through the peephole of Joey and Chandlers door. Meanwhile, Monica dates a millionaire, and Joey is cast in a play and clashes with the female lead.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica inherits a beautiful dollhouse that is too elaborate to play with, so Phoebe makes her own, but it meets a sad end. Meanwhile, Joey thinks hes found his true love, and Rachels boss dates Chandler, placing her in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With a Chick and a Duck
programme.desc: When Monicas millionaire friend Pete buys a restaurant and asks Monica to be the head chef, she is faced with a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Ross makes a sacrifice for Rachel, and Joey buys Chandler an unusual pet.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends go to the opening night of one of Joeys plays. When Rachel finds out that Ross is bringing a date, she finds one of her own. Ross tries to convince Rachel that her date is mentally unbalanced. Meanwhile, Joeys play gets terrible reviews, but his co-star provides some comfort.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross develops a skin growth that doctors cant identify.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ultimate Fighting Champion

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe invites everyone to stay at her massage clients beach house for the weekend. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Joey lose all their furniture, Monica finds that one date with her high-school heartthrob is more than enough, and Ross plays tricks on Rachel following their break-up. Elsewhere, Phoebe is temporarily convinced that a cat is the reincarnation of her dead adoptive mother Lily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler has a brief fling with Rachels boss Joanna which leaves him handcuffed without his trousers in her office. Meanwhile, Joey can only afford one book in an encyclopaedia set, and Monica caters a party for her mother.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ballroom Dancing

programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys New Girlfriend

programme.sub-title: The One With the Dirty Girl

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Crosses the Line

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: A band of Confederate soldiers capture a large consignment of Yankee gold, then go on the run with their haul when they realise that the war has ended. Although no longer threatened by the Yankees, they soon find themselves under attack from ruthless bandits determined to get their hands on the gold.

programme.title: The Iron Petticoat
programme.desc: A humourless Russian, Captain Vinka Kovelenko, defects from her home country. Major Chuck Lockwood is assigned to show her the bright lights of London while she tries to convince him of the superiority of communism. Naturally, the two opposites fall in love but then must contend with the KGB, who are not happy with the idea of one of their officers running around free in London.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: A British police inspector waits for an escaped local criminal to return to his home in Manchester to pick up the spoils from his last job.

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: The delightful tale of Robin Hood and Maid Marian in their twilight years. Robin, back from the Crusades, finds his love has become the Abbess of a priory and that his arch enemy, the Sheriff of Nottingham still wants him dead.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: Apocalyptic thriller in which life on Earth is threatened by a rogue comet. When a reporter in pursuit of a Washington sex scandal is arrested by the FBI, she discovers that the story is an inconsequential part of a huge cover-up. She soon finds herself in possession of the biggest story in the history of humankind - the planet will be destroyed in one year, unless a risky outer-space mission can deflect the comet.

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Paul Edgecomb, the head guard of death row, just wants life for him, his colleagues and the condemned to be nice and easy. However, when Michael Clarke Duncan, a man-mountain convicted of murdering two little white girls arrives, things start to get strange. How can he cure Edgecombs urinary infection with a touch, bring a dead pet mouse back to life and cure the wardens wifes cancer? Is he innocent?

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: Two free-grazing cattlemen, looking to live a peaceful life, find their peace is shattered and they are forced to ride for revenge when a ruthless rancher attempts to run them out of town.

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver takes on three comfort food classics. Hes also joined by friend Christian, aka `DJ BBQ, to reveal his ultimate burger - including what cut of meat to use (chuck steak), how to cook it and what to have on the side.

programme.title: Jamies Comfort Food
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is joined by his friend Gennaro to make the perfect bolognese ravioli. Jamie also creates the ultimate cheese toastie and he cooks his take on the nations favourite dish - chicken tikka masala - cooked over an open fire.

programme.desc: Tom Kerridge travels to Tucson, Arizona to experience fantastic food. He cooks his own version of beef brisket chilli and harvests cactus fruit.

programme.title: Tom Kerridges America
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge travels to Pittsburgh to experience fantastic food. He cooks his own version of a meatball sub and learns how to make traditional Polish dumplings.

Who will crumble when it comes to judging and whose ginger nuts are too hot to handle?

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: In round five, everyone is out to avoid the dreaded soggy bottom as the seven remaining bakers face pies. Theyll begin with their signature family pie, before the dreaded technical challenge which sees lifelong vegetarian Jason delivering six beautifully baked and seasoned pork pies to the judging table. Finally, there is a sweet showstopper challenge in the shape of a meringue pie.

programme.desc: Louisianas lush plantation country is the next stop on James Martins American Adventure. Stylish historical epic retelling the fierce battle at Thermopylae in 481BC. The Spartan king, Leonidas, and his tiny army of 300 followers provided inspiration for the whole of Greece as they fought the massed ranks of the Persian army whose commander, King Xerxes, had up to a million warriors at his disposal.

programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck actress accepts an offer to star in a film shot on a mysterious island. Stylish historical epic retelling the fierce battle at Thermopylae in 481BC. The Spartan king, Leonidas, and his tiny army of 300 followers provided inspiration for the whole of Greece as they fought the massed ranks of the Persian army whose commander, King Xerxes, had up to a million warriors at his disposal.

programme.title: William Tell
programme.desc: In 14th Century Switzerland, a once peaceful hunter leads his people in rebellion after his family and country are threatened by a tyrannical Austrian King. As the Holy Roman Empire crumbles, the quiet lives of the Swiss peasants are upended.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck actress accepts an offer to star in a film shot on a mysterious island. While there, the actress is abducted by natives who offer her as a sacrifice to a giant ape, which instead of harming the starlet becomes smitten with her. The crew manage to capture the ape and bring it back to Manhattan to exhibit as a showpiece. However, on the shows opening night, things go horribly wrong.

programme.title: Twisters
programme.desc: Competing teams of storm chasers find themselves in a fight for their lives as multiple systems converge over central Oklahoma.

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: An apocalyptic story set in the furthest reaches of our planet, in a stark desert landscape where humanity is broken. Two rebels on the run may be able to restore order.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after a five-year absence to find Lex Luthor ready to take over the world, and Lois Lane shacked up with a new man and a kid. The people have lost faith in their former saviour. Can Superman save their lives and regain their trust?

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Outside influences affect the way the worlds first thinking, feeling robot lives and behaves.

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Outside influences affect the way the worlds first thinking, feeling robot lives and behaves.

programme.title: The Inventor
programme.desc: The insatiably curious Leonardo da Vinci leaves Italy to join the French court, where he can experiment freely, invent incredible machines and study the human body. He is joined on his adventure by the audacious French princess Marguerite de Nevarre.

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: Otis the cow is a wild-living party animal and just loves to dance until dawn, but then his dad is killed by coyotes, and Otis has to become the responsible leader of the rest of the all-singing, all-dancing farm animals.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Mechs vs. Mutants
programme.desc: Gotham City faces catastrophe when Mr Freeze transforms Killer Croc and Bane into mega-sized mutant monsters. As the gigantic villains go on the rampage, its up to the caped crusader to cut them down to size.

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: An opportunistic raccoon teaches fellow animals about the edible treasures that the new humans in the neighbourhood conveniently leave outdoors.

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: Draculas spell turns a woman and her loved ones into a vampire, a mummy, a werewolf and Frankensteins monster.

programme.title: Monster Family 2
programme.desc: Baba Yaga and Renfield are captured by a monster hunter so the Wishbone family once again transform into a vampire Frankensteins monster a mummy and a werewolf in a bid to free them.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Concerned that his half-human grandson isnt showing his vampire side, Dracula and his friends put the boy through a `monster-in-training boot camp just as Dracs old-school father decides to pay a visit.

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens
programme.desc: When an evil alien attacks the Earth, a motley crew of monsters is called into action to save the world from imminent destruction. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Mavis surprises Dracula with plans for a fun-filled summer voyage on a monster cruise. As the pack starts enjoying colossal buffets and exotic excursions, Drac finds himself falling for the ships intriguing but dangerous captain. He soon learns that trying to balance family, friends and romance might just be too much to handle. even for the worlds most powerful vampire.

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: A pig, a mouse, a porcupine, a gorilla, an elephant and other animals gather at a koalas theatre for a singing competition.

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: Otis the cow is a wild-living party animal and just loves to dance until dawn, but then his dad is killed by coyotes, and Otis has to become the responsible leader of the rest of the all-singing, all-dancing farm animals.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Animal Instincts
programme.desc: When the beast-themed Animilitia plague Gotham, Batman swings out to investigate. But with The Penguin and his cyber-animals added to the mix, Batman will need the help of Green Arrow and The Flash to bring them to heel.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: The children and their bickering family are stranded on a desert island. Fortunately help is at hand from the Thornberry family, who are visiting the island to film a rare snow leopard. Once again, animal-understanding Eliza saves the day.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Monster Mayhem
programme.desc: The Dark Knight assembles his heroic friends like Green Arrow and Nightwing to stop the Joker and his cronies from unleashing a diabolical computer virus.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Monster Mayhem
programme.desc: The Dark Knight assembles his heroic friends like Green Arrow and Nightwing to stop the Joker and his cronies from unleashing a diabolical computer virus.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: A rude, drug-abusing educator vies with a perky colleague for the attentions of a rich and handsome substitute teacher.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: The continuing adventures of the Portokalos family. A follow-up to the 2002 comedy, My Big Fat Greek Wedding.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Deeds is much-loved in his small town, but following the death of a long-lost uncle, who also happens to be a billionaire tycoon, Deeds inherits a fortune and heads for the big city to run his uncles company. When a media frenzy ensues surrounding Deeds inheritance, reporter Babe Bennett goes undercover to out Deeds as the small-town fool she thinks he is.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Rumours
programme.desc: Leaders of the worlds wealthiest democracies become spectacles of incompetence, contending with increasingly surreal obstacles as night falls in the misty woods and they realise they are suddenly alone.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait
programme.desc: An American footballer is given the body of a wealthy industrialist after an inept angel prematurely claims his life.

programme.title: Kingpin
programme.desc: An ex-professional bowler and his talented Amish protege hustle their way across the country to a big-money tournament.

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: Billy is the son of hotel chain magnate Brian Madison and expects to inherit the family fortune, but hes shocked when his father stipulates he wont unless he passes 12th grade in just 24 weeks. It will be tough, since he never passed 1st grade. Determined to prove his father wrong, Billy enrols at school.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: The continuing adventures of the Portokalos family. A follow-up to the 2002 comedy, My Big Fat Greek Wedding.

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: An uncouth FBI agent goes undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant as a contestant to flush out a terrorist who plans to bomb the event. The hard-nosed cop, who prides herself on her toughness, must discard her trainers and feminise her behaviour if she is to avoid blowing her cover.

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie is given another makeover to become the face of the Bureau, prior to embarking on a promotional tour. When two of her friends are kidnapped - Miss USA and a beauty pageant director - she decides to investigate on her own, in defiance of orders to the contrary.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Nick, Dale and Kurt all despise their bosses, but who would be crazy enough to quit their jobs in such poor economic times? The trio drunkenly and hypothetically discuss how to kill their bosses, and before they know it, theyve hired a murder consultant to help them pull off the three deeds.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: Escaping postwar Europe, a visionary architect comes to America to rebuild his life, his career, and his marriage. On his own in a strange new country, he settles in Pennsylvania, where a wealthy and prominent industrialist recognises his talent.

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: A conflicted Navy pilot and veteran of the Second World War questions the role he is forced to play when he is called back into service for the Korean War.

programme.title: Schindlers List
programme.desc: True story of German businessman Oskar Schindlers efforts to save his Jewish workers from being exterminated in Nazi concentration camps.

programme.title: The Fisher King
programme.desc: When a DJs sardonic exhortation to a late-night caller to wipe out a bar full of yuppies is taken literally, his world falls apart. Years later, on the point of suicide, he is saved by a similar casualty, a former medievalist whose wife was a victim of the bar bloodbath, and offered a chance for redemption by the mans quest for the Holy Grail.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: When his fathers job results in a family move to the countryside, young German boy Bruno misses his old friends. Roaming the grounds of the large country house he now calls home, he discovers the huge fenced facility that his dad Ralf, a Nazi officer, now manages. Approaching it, Bruno meets Shmuel, a fellow youngster on the other side of the barbed wire, wearing what appears to be a pair of pyjamas.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: The story of photographer Elizabeth `Lee Miller, a fashion model who became an acclaimed war correspondent for Vogue magazine during World War II.

programme.title: Just Friends
programme.desc: An LA record producer returns to his New Jersey hometown ten years after being rejected by his high-school cheerleader crush. Having made the transformation from no-hope geek to Greek god womaniser and with his friend still single, he embarks on a second seduction strategy that does not always go to plan.

programme.title: Valentines Day
programme.desc: Following a group of Los Angeles residents who try to find their way through the highs and lows of love during a single day.

programme.title: Amadeus
programme.desc: Once the highly regarded composer to the Viennese Court, Salieri is now an old man, unknown and confined to an asylum. After a suicide attempt he recounts his story to a young cleric, going back 30 years to his heyday at the court of Emperor Joseph II, where he first met the young Mozart. Despite Salieris Machiavellian attempts to frustrate Mozarts progress, the great young composer attracts the favour of the Emperor.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: The story of British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: High-spirited musical set in 1950s America, in which a girl and boy who met on the beach are unexpectedly reunited at high school. She cannot understand how different he has become. Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: Endearing film version of Lionel Barts successful stage musical based on Dickenss tale of the fluctuating fortunes of an orphan boy. Ron Moody stands out as the wily old scrounger Fagin in a series of well-crafted set-pieces and atmospheric musical numbers, and a tribe of child stars brings the 19th-century London underworld vividly to life.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Dreamer Max, ridiculed by his classmates, conjures up his perfect dreamworld - the Planet Drool, but his dream is more powerful than even he suspects, and his favourite dream superheroes, Sharkboy and Lavagirl, materialise on Earth. They bring news that an alien intelligence is threatening his beloved Planet Drool. Is it true, as Sharkboy and Lavagirl say, that only Max can stop it?

programme.title: Goosebumps
programme.desc: A young kid teams up with the niece of young adult horror author R.L. Stine after the writers imaginary demons are set free on the town of Greendale, Maryland.

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: Spoof spy caper with the eponymous, blundering hero attempting to recover the crown jewels and save Britain from an evil mastermind when all the other agents are killed. Promoted from lowly pen pusher to super spy, Johnny English is baffled when clues lead to respected entrepreneur Pascal Sauvage, but could the enigmatic Lorna hold the key to the mystery?

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man ventures into the realm of fairies to retrieve a fallen star in order to win the heart of his beloved.

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Prehistoric prequel in which working-class college leavers Fred and Barney decide to set off for a fun weekend in Rock Vegas with their two new girlfriends, Wilma and Betty. Fred, however, has a rival for the affections of his classy girlfriend Wilma - the wealthy playboy Chip Rockefeller.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: Endearing film version of Lionel Barts successful stage musical based on Dickenss tale of the fluctuating fortunes of an orphan boy. Ron Moody stands out as the wily old scrounger Fagin in a series of well-crafted set-pieces and atmospheric musical numbers, and a tribe of child stars brings the 19th-century London underworld vividly to life.

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Live-action version of the classic stone-age cartoon series. Fred Flintstone donates his family savings to help neighbour Barney Rubble and wife Betty adopt a child, much to the dismay of mother-in-law Pearl. To return the favour, Barney swaps slabs with Fred in an aptitude test, resulting in Freds being promoted and becoming involved in an embezzlement plot, while Barney is left in the dole queue.

programme.title: Bean: The Ultimate Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Mr Bean has somehow managed to get a job as a security guard. His latest assignment finds him travelling to America as an art expert, looking after the famous `Whistlers Mother painting as it is transported from Britain to a posh new Los Angeles museum. The catch is that Bean is no art expert and his trip was a ploy by his British employers to get rid of him. Unfortunately, no one has warned the Americans about Mr Bean.

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: Theres trouble brewing in Bikini Bottom. Someone has stolen King Neptunes crown, and it looks like Mr Krab, SpongeBobs boss, is the culprit. Though hes just been passed over for the promotion of his dreams, SpongeBob stands by his boss, and along with his best pal Patrick, sets out on a treacherous mission to Shell City to reclaim the crown and save Mr Krabs life.

programme.title: Cats and Dogs
programme.desc: Unknown to humans, all-out war between cats and dogs has raged since the beginning of time. Now the cats face defeat if scientist Professor Brody can perfect a formula that will make all humans non-allergic to dogs. The cats leader, Mr Tinkles, plans to steal the serum, but first he must get past fearless dog agent Lou who, thanks to a mistake in recruitment, guards the Brody family.

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
programme.desc: Two twin brothers, Jared and Simon, and their sister Mallory are relocated by their mother to their great-great uncles creepy home in the middle of nowhere. Exploring, Jared finds his great-great uncles secret study and a book, the `Field Guide to the Fantastical World around Them, which opens up a world of goblins, spirits, ogres, trolls and griffins, some of whom are friendly and helpful and others not.

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: Washed-up stuntman Luo seeks help from his estranged daughter and her lawyer boyfriend when his beloved stunt horse may be auctioned off to pay his debts. Luo and Red Hare become a media sensation when their fight with debt collectors goes viral.

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: A wisecracking parrot caged in a research lab tells his life story to a lonely janitor. Before coming to the science lab, he has passed through the hands of a succession of owners, from a petty criminal to a man who runs a parrot-dancing act. Touched by his colourful story, the janitor conspires to liberate the talking bird.
